spike
  • PSF Generation
  • View page source

PSF Generation

Functions included here relate to the creation of PSFs, which will later be drizzled by the HST, JWST, or Roman pipeline functions.

spike.psfgen.effpsf()

Generate PSFs using the empirical photutils.epsf routine.

spike.psfgen.jwpsf()

Generate JWST and Roman PSFs using WebbPSF.

spike.psfgen.sepsf()

Generate PSFs using PSFEx.

spike.psfgen.stdpsf(coords, img, pretweaked=False, keeporig=True, plot=False, keep=False, verbose=False)

Read in HST STDPSFs.

spike.psfgen.tinygillispsf(coords, img, plot=False, keep=False, verbose=False)

Generate HST PSFs using TinyTim and the parameter changes laid out in Gillis et al (2020). In addition to making model PSF, write tweak parameters to header.

Note that the Gillis et al. (2020) code will be downloaded to your working directory. If keep = False (default), it will be removed after use.

Parameters:

  • coords (list) – Pixel coordinates of object of interest. [X, Y, chip]

  • img (str) – Path to image for which PSF is generated.

  • img_type (str) – ‘flc’, ‘flt’, ‘c0f’, ‘c1f’ – specifies which file-type to include.

  • inst (str) – ‘ACS’, ‘WFC3’, ‘WFPC2’, ‘FOC’, ‘NICMOS’

  • plot (bool) – If True, saves .pngs of the model PSFs.

  • keep (bool) – If True, retains make_psf.py (Gillis et al. 2020)

  • verbose (bool) – If True, prints progress messages.

spike.psfgen.tinypsf(coords, img, plot=False, verbose=False, jitter=None, sampling=2)

Generate HST PSFs using TinyTim. In addition to making model PSF, write tweak parameters to header.

Parameters:

  • coords (list) – Pixel coordinates of object of interest.[X, Y, chip]

  • img (str) – Path to image for which PSF is generated.

  • img_type (str) – ‘flc’, ‘flt’, ‘c0f’, ‘c1f’ – specifies which file-type to include.

  • plot (bool) – If True, saves .pngs of the model PSFs.

  • verbose (bool) – If True, prints progress messages.
